title: Milan Babić (footballer)
text:
Milan Babić (; born 5 August 1955) is a former <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er known for having played for the three major Serbian clubs; <a href="Red%20Star%20Belgrade">Red Star</a>, <a href="FK%20Partizan">Partizan</a> and <a href="FK%20Vojvodina">Vojvodina</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Nakovo">Nakovo</a>, in municipality of <a href="Kikinda">Kikinda</a>, in <a href="SR%20Serbia">SR Serbia</a>, back at that time still within Yugoslavia, Babić started playing as defender with powerhouse <a href="Red%20Star%20Belgrade">Red Star Belgrade</a>. He made his debut in the <a href="1975%E2%80%9376%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">1975–76 Yugoslav First League</a> and left Red Star at winter-break of <a href="1977%E2%80%9378%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">1977–78</a> season to played the second half of season with <a href="FK%20Radnik%20Bijeljina">FK Radnik Bijeljina</a> in the 1977–78 Yugoslav Second League.
In summer 1978 he joined <a href="FK%20Napredak%20Kru%C5%A1evac">FK Napredak Kruševac</a> at time playing in the <a href="Yugoslav%20First%20League">Yugoslav First League</a>. Babić will marked an entire period of Napredak as he will play in the club since the late 1970s till mid 1980s. His performances with Napredak at top level were so solid that he was brought by the other Yugoslav powerhouse, <a href="FK%20Partizan">FK Partizan</a>, to play in the first half of the <a href="1980%E2%80%9381%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">1980–81 Yugoslav First League</a>. At winter-break he returned to Napredak to help them avoid relegation, however the club failed. Despite that, Babić stay at Napredak three more years playing in the <a href="Yugoslav%20Second%20League">Yugoslav Second League</a>, all the way till the winter-break of <a href="1983%E2%80%9384%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">1983–84</a> season, when he was signed by <a href="FK%20Vojvodina">FK Vojvodina</a>, thus making his return to the First League.
After a season and a half at Vojvodina, Babić accepted a move abroad, signing in summer 1985 with French <a href="Ligue%202">Ligue 2</a> side <a href="AS%20B%C3%A9ziers%20H%C3%A9rault%20%28football%29">AS Béziers Hérault</a>. After a season with Béziers, his spell in France was followed by four more seasons at French second level, by playing with <a href="FC%20Montceau%20Bourgogne">FC Montceau Bourgogne</a>.
